顫動 [ chàn dòng ]: to tremble
顫巍巍 [ chàn wēi wēi ]: trembling; swaying; flickering; tottering; faltering

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Seeing Mr. Hyde's head will make anyone tremble.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " page ", "亶" sound. The original meaning is head swinging. "Shuowen": "Trembling, the head is not right. From the page, the sound." "The head is not right" Duan Yucai changed to "The head is not fixed." Paragraph note: "Uncertain, each of the works is not correct, now it is correct." The extension means that the body is trembling and trembling. Such as "Huainanzi. "Speaking Mountains": "Those who are cold tremble, and those who are afraid also tremble. The same name is different." Tang Dynasty Bai Juyi's "Painting Bamboo Songs": "It is a pity that Xiao Lang and Xiao Lang are old, hands tremble, eyes dizzy and snowy.

" Chatter " can represent objects vibrate. Such as Zhou Bangyan in the Northern Song Dynasty (Liu Chou. Falling Flowers>: "In the end it is not like a hairpin head trembling, turning to the side." "Journey to the West" Chapter 23: "The head is full of pearls, trembling and countless precious hairpin hairpins; the body is fragrant, and there are delicate flowers and golden strands. ."

" Trembling " also means that the nose is clear and can distinguish smells. "Ji Yun. "Xian Yun": "Trembling, the nose is trembling, it is said that the trial is due to the smell of breath." Such as "Zhuangzi. "Foreign Objects": "The eyes are clear, the ears are clong, and the nose is trembling." "Liezi. Yang Zhu ":" The nose is the voice of those who pepper to Portland, and not smell, that of the shut chatter "Zhan Zhang said:" Nose said through chattering. "" Shut "is a blocking means. No smell can be smelled because of blocked nose.
humanum_short_description_en: From " page ", "亶" sound. The original meaning is head swinging.
humanum_full_description:
從「頁」，「亶」聲。本義是頭部搖擺不定。《說文》：「顫，頭不正也。从頁，亶聲。」「頭不正」段玉裁改為「頭不定」。段注：「不定，各本作不正，今正。」引申表示身體發抖、顫動。如《淮南子．說山》：「故寒者顫，懼者亦顫，此同名而異實。」唐代白居易〈畫竹歌〉：「蕭郎蕭郎老可惜，手顫眼昏頭雪色。」

　　「顫」亦可表示物體顫動。如北宋周邦彥〈六醜．落花〉：「終不似一朵釵頭顫裊，向人欹側。」《西遊記》第23回：「滿頭珠翠，顫巍巍無數寶釵簪；遍體幽香，嬌滴滴有花金縷細。」

　　「顫」又表示鼻通，能辨別氣味。《集韻．仙韻》：「顫，鼻徹為顫，謂審於氣臭也。」如《莊子．外物》：「目徹為明，耳徹為聰，鼻徹為顫。」《列子．楊朱》：「鼻之所欲向者椒蘭，而不得嗅，謂之閼顫。」張湛曰：「鼻通曰顫。」「閼」是阻塞的意思。因為鼻子阻塞不通，嗅不到氣味。
humanum_short_description: 從「頁」，「亶」聲。本義是頭部搖擺不定。

Chinese: Seeing Mr. Hyde's head will make anyone tremble.
Meaning: tremble
Hanzi: 颤
Story: Seeing Mr. Hyde's head will make anyone tremble.
Kind: traditional

從「 頁 」，「 亶 」聲。本義是頭部搖擺不定。《說文》：「顫，頭不正也。从頁，亶聲。」「頭不正」段玉裁改為「頭不定」。段注：「不定，各本作不正，今正。」引申表示身體發抖、顫動。如《淮南子．說山》：「故寒者顫，懼者亦顫，此同名而異實。」唐代白居易〈畫竹歌〉：「蕭郎蕭郎老可惜，手顫眼昏頭雪色。」 「 顫 」亦可表示物體顫動。如北宋周邦彥〈六醜．落花〉：「終不似一朵釵頭顫裊，向人欹側。」《西遊記》第23回：「滿頭珠翠，顫巍巍無數寶釵簪；遍體幽香，嬌滴滴有花金縷細。」 「 顫 」又表示鼻通，能辨別氣味。《集韻．仙韻》：「顫，鼻徹為顫，謂審於氣臭也。」如《莊子．外物》：「目徹為明，耳徹為聰，鼻徹為顫。」《列子．楊朱》：「鼻之所欲向者椒蘭，而不得嗅，謂之閼顫。」張湛曰：「鼻通曰顫。」「 閼 」是阻塞的意思。因為鼻子阻塞不通，嗅不到氣味。

The extension means that the body is trembling and trembling. Such as "Huainanzi. "Speaking Mountains": "Those who are cold tremble, and those who are afraid also tremble. The same name is different." Tang Dynasty Bai Juyi's "Painting Bamboo Songs": "It is a pity that Xiao Lang and Xiao Lang are old, hands tremble, eyes dizzy and snowy. " Chatter" can represent objects vibrate. Such as Zhou Bangyan in the Northern Song Dynasty (Liu Chou. Falling Flowers>: "In the end it is not like a hairpin head trembling, turning to the side." 顫字的基本解释

顫
chàn

顫字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chàn］［zhàn］
［《廣韻》之膳切，去線，章。］
“颤1”的繁体字。
(1)身体颤动。
(2)物体震动。
(3)通“憚”。惧怕；惊恐。
[②]［shān］
［《集韻》尸連切，平，書。］
“颤2”的繁体字。
鼻通能辨气味。

顫字的康熙字典解释

【戌集下】【頁字部】　顫； 康熙笔画：22； 页码：页1410第05
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?之膳切，音戰。【玉篇】頭不正也。　又【廣韻】四支寒動也。　又【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?尸連切，音羶。【集韻】謂審於氣臭也。【莊子·外物篇】鼻徹爲顫。【音義】顫，舒延反。
